name: Gramene Maize
description: Comparative plant genomics focused on maize varieties

slides.label: NAM founder inbreds
slides.text: This site includes full genome sequences of the NAM founder lines and comparative genomic analyses of protein-coding gene families.

slides.label: Type-ahead search
slides.text: Click in the search box and start typing to find matching terms. Select a suggested term to define a search filter. Add more filters at any time by searching for another search term.

slides.label: Search results for homologs of lox1
slides.text: The taxo(ge)nomic distribution of search results highlights positions of genes on the assembled chromosomes. Drag-select regions to refine the search.

slides.label: Expression: EBI Atlas view
slides.text: This view depicts baseline gene expression data for a whole plant (top anatogram on the left of the results box) and for the plantâ€™s reproductive organs (bottom anatogram). Experiments are organized by study on the left side, and by tissue or developmental stage on the top of the graph.

slides.label: Homology: Alignment overview
slides.text: The homology tab displays an interactive gene tree visualization. The alignment overview mode shows a zoomed-out view of the multiple sequence alignment, coded by Interpro domain.

slides.label: Homology: Multiple sequence alignment
slides.text: The multiple sequence alignment mode lets you zoom in to explore differences among the sequences in a gene family.

slides.label: Homology: Neighborhood Conservation view
slides.text: This view presents the target gene in the middle with a vertical red line connecting the homologs from each genome in the tree plus 10 flanking genes upstream and downstream color-coded by gene family. This allows you to identify structural variants and Presence/Absence variants in the region in question.

slides.label: Pathways: Plant Reactome view
slides.text: From the literature, we know that lox9 is part of the jasmonic acid (JA) biosynthesis pathway. Accordingly, the Pathways panel shows that this gene product catalyzes a reaction in two pathways, JA biosynthesis, and 13-LOX/13-HPL.
